FOREWORD

Millions of people hit the road each year, to get away from their old surroundings, to see and learn how people live, and meet new and old friends.

Modern travel has given millions of people an opportunity 1 to see the wonders of the World. Thousands and thousands of ' dollars are spent each year on various modes of transportation. Money spent in this manner brings added revenue to tradesmen throughout the country.

The White traveler has had no difﬁculty in getting accom- modations, but with the Negro it has been different. He, before the advent of a Negro travel guide, had to depend on word of mouth, and many times accommodations were not available.

Now things are different. The Negro traveler can depend on the “GREEN BOOK” for all the information he wants, and has a wide selection to choose from. Hence this guide has made traveling more popular, without encountering embarrassing situations.

We appreciate letters from the public telling us about places that are not listed in the “GREEN BOOK.” We also welcome your comments and opinions. We are now and shall always continue to be interested in your welfare. Your co- operation will enable us to reach the summit of our goal and further our eﬁorts in giving “ASSURED PROTECTION FOR

THE NEGRO TRAVELER.”

*Denotes The Negro Travelers’ Green Book recommended Hotel, Motels, Tourist Homes, etc.

(Omission of * does not necessarily mean inferior accommodations.)
